page.title: 02ARABLE FARMING HARDWICK AREA
page.content: The area is mainly arable,growing winter wheat,barley & some sugar beet. A few fields of freezer peas,field beans,oil seed rape,strawberries & mustard(Colmans)are grown & 1 apple orchard.Hay is made for winter feed, the first crop was spoilt by continuous rain,better quality was made in August.Average yield of wheat was 2-2\ tons per acre,3/4 ton less than last year's record;winter& spring barley yielded 1 3/4 tons.Most straw was baled for use as winter feed & bedding or fuel,very little was burnt on field.Harvesting started early August,was interrupted by rain, finished mid September,but was speeded up where grain dryers were used,wet conditions spoilt quality.1 farmer is carrying out a nationwide trial on the effect fungicides have on wildlife.
